name: hexjumper
text: You can just feel Ray concentrating as he speaks that last line.

name: waddlerz
text: A comment left by waddlerz was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by twntysevn27, Afterward, riotdejaneiro, anticitizen, Feralig8tr, mustconcentrate, Boyd)

name: sweetlips
text: No, Ray needs for Philippe to stay by that ugly plant. You can't check on your Harman Kardons and solve mysteries with a five year old otter telling you all about how you should like 1882 because some boring guy was nice.

name: fuzzyshoo
text: The ugly plant makes it for me. It's just so randomly there and it does a fine job of breaking up the urgency of Ray's Harmon Kardon situation.

name: lastlarf
text: Ray's home entertainment system has it's own security force. This man is LARGE.

name: gazdatronik
text: Ray would, with his wealth and lack of knowlege buy a pricey harmon kardon setup and then have a security force watch them. He could have gone with krell, or vandersteen, tannoy, or bowers & wilkins, but he picked the skim milk of high end audio. Ray you simple man. Totally fits with his character.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: At least he didn't have a Bose setup. Then you'd know that he not only is simple and tasteless, his own music must have been likewise, by extension.

name: gazdatronik
text: Yes. Bose is to audio as Saab is to cars

name: dusty
text: Right at that level where the everyday folks think your a snob but the classy types just roll their eyes at you.

name: gazdatronik
text: Hey I think you just defined something pretty well, I gotta use that.

name: jamb23
text: I have BOSE headphones and I think they are quite nice! Although I'd trade them in for the ability to make split second value judgements about people on the Internet.

name: dusty
text: Maybe you should see if your local university offers High-Midlevel electronic owner american studies. Learning about the history of preconceptions of people who own high-midlevel electronics can help you cope with this kind of blind hatred.

name: jamb23
text: Are they really that bad? My headphone standards are quite low admittedly, as I only got this pair when you could properly see all the wires hanging out of my last pair and the quality had deteriorated to the point where it sounded like all my music had been recorded in a metal rubbish bin, so perhaps I'm not the martyr the Bose cause has been waiting for.

name: dusty
text: In a time where lames are like water on planet dune I managed to extract one by indirectly making fun of Bose.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
No deal.


But, seriously, I don't know anything about their cans or buds, they may be nice. Bose speakers, however, have been pretentious dreck for decades.

name: gazdatronik
text:
Like the Bose 901!

"GODDAMIT CARL do you know how much R&D we've put into this 4 inch speaker over the last 40 years!!!! Lets just sell it...It has a frequency response curve like a fucking rainbow, but that means we can make extra money selling the companion equalizer to correct how shitty these things really sound!!!"

This may be apocryphal.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
*rollin' large.

but yeah, he is large, too.

'why are you making fun of me, mom?'

name: untilyouaresonude
text: I love that Ray and Phillipe are pretty good friends.

name: honesttom
text: They are rad friends. They... are... rad... friends!

name: spinynorman
text:
They think at the same level. I bet if you put them in front of a toy truck they could rock that shit for hours on end.

At evening Beef would be calling in Ray and Teodor would call in Philippe

They'd stall or hide behind a tree and giggle

name: swatson
text: AWWWWWWW!

name: terrordactyl
text: your avatar made me cry when i was 8

name: aliiis
text: but there is also the matter of "Well BLAH blah BLAH blah BLAH blah BLAH!". I have so much love for this comeback. To a five-year-old. Otter.

name: i_love_kate
text: Ray mocks in iambs.

name: cagliostro
text:
Which is completely correct, since iambs seem to have started life as the metre of mockery and abuse.

Damn. Strange forces are at work here.

name: i_love_kate
text: ...Butter pie?

name: cagliostro
text: No thanks, I'm trying to quit.

name: greenkoolayd
text: i hardly know'er pie!

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
That is how one rationalizes one's outright lying to a 5-year old.


Parents do it all the time.

name: catachresis
text:
I met a guy who had Harman Kardon speakers in his laptop after reading this strip (and making the requisite google search).
He did not understand why I was so impressed.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: H/Ks are some fine, fine speakers.

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
I can certainly dig on some h/ks. That's what I have hooked up to my computer.

No rent-a-cops for 'em, though. I'm small time.

name: arcibi
text: Having Philippe stand by the ugly plant was a wise course of action

name: bazookaradio
text:
The ugly plant must not be on Ray's expensive lawn.

Also, do you imagine that ugly plant will someday grow into THE Ugly Tree?

name: zaratustra
text: That's what the eBay page said when Ray bought it, at least. "GUARANTEED TO GROW INTO THE UGLIEST TREE!!!!! L@@K INTO YOUR PAST AND--"

name: syrinx
text: I've always found Teodor to be the hardest Achewood character to pin down.  The fact that he owns a Howard Jones blanket doesn't help me a damn bit.

name: nessotron
text: Onstad has somewhat divulged that Teoder is most like him. I see him as the observant, "normal" character amongst the cast, and he often takes the role of the reader.

name: nessotron
text: Also, this explains why Teoder is often seen drawing. As I assume Onstad does, or did, with his comic.

name: riazm
text: I thought it was because Teodor was a graphic designer. (I think Onstad was a graphic designer at some point in his life)

name: zeal
text:
There are two characters in Achewood who draw. Teodor...and Nice Pete.

I'll leave you to your conclusions.

name: hateandwar
text: What about all the times we see Ray drawing, his fears and that one time he can't stop drawing penises?

name: red_dawn
text: I love that Philippe says, "There might be machine guns!" as if they are a threat by themselves, without anyone to weild them.

name: nutmeg
text: it's the posters with the hairy avatar characters that get it right, every time. every time.

name: invidious
text: I love that Philippe says, "There might be machine guns!" considering that, you know, Ray's heading into his own house and (presumably) would know where all the machine guns are.

name: chaesar
text: Beef sure loves doing his damn taxes.

name: connellingus
text: It would seem otherwise, if he waited until September to do them, since he couldn't do his forthcoming taxes until the year was up. I'm surprised he didn't get lethal injection.

name: mikekitchell
text: It is a very rad thing to do your taxes early

name: elohssa
text: I love Philippe, and "Machineguns!" is one on my favorite lines of his.

name: coconutjohn
text: A comment left by coconutjohn was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by divot, katsura, Sleaw, choosebro, I_Love_Kate, Darthemed)

name: philosophe
text: Lyle's Palm III???

name: ttagxamm
text:
That's the "wha-HUH?!" moment of the strip right there.

What's he keep in there? Bussing shifts he's picked up covering for Robbie who's taking ESL classes? Appts with the eye doctor? Reminders when to go find Cornelius and be a botheration?

Court dates.

name: griffypoo
text: Same thing here.  My first thought was that he kept a trial version of mixed drink recipe software on there, but that quickly fell through as he seems to take all his liquor straight.  Court dates is a solid guess, too.  For Lyle, any other use he'd have evades me.

name: utv
text:
No, this one rang true for me. In grade school, my best friend's dad gave him an old, company b&w Palm III, with like 2Mb of memory, and we thought it was the coolest shit ever, despite not really having any use for it.

We'd make memos like 'kick Steve in ass,' follow through, and then tick it off the to-do list.

name: songbirdspectre
text: The best prayer ever.

name: jesler729
text: We love you just for trying, Ray.

name: jesler729
text: A comment left by jesler729 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Homepie, Sleaw, foetus_punch, Wite_Rabit)

name: phthoggos
text: Nobody has remarked on the word "colden."

name: zefiel
text: Why don't you have a chubby, you manic lagomorph.

name: falseprophet
text: Its remarkableness goes without saying.

name: random_shorts
text: Remark /r%u026A%u02C8m%u0251rk/ [ri-mahrk]: 1. To say casually, as in making a comment.

name: bourbonsamurai
text:
When I first read this I thought "What the Braveheart?" was like an oath that Ray swore.

Also, the last line is my favorite achewood line ever.

name: em2
text: Five for the last line in the last panel alone.

name: charchar
text: Somewhere, that cold onion & stromboli pizza is waiting to thrill my tongue and then promptly kick my stomach's ass.

name: jhunter
text:
c'mon Yahweh
help a brother out

name: satyr
text: I really want to know who drinks Red Stripe.

name: aseidel
text: I bet its Teodor and Todd splitting the case, with Mr. Bear having one or two.

name: ep2
text: The last line is classic, but for some reason I just love the ugly plant. Poor thing.

name: aseidel
text: That is one ugly plant.

name: maidenathene
text: I have used "please.help.me.see.the.connection.here" phrase a couple of times. I forgot I was quoting Achewood though.
